website_summaries.verdict: Water leak sensor that allows you to add up to 100 feet of wire to place sensor in desired location.
pros: Highly sensitive water leak sensor that measures water as shallow as 1/32 of an inch
Sensor ships with 6 feet of wire to attach to base unit, but you can add 100 additional feet if desired
Makes use of a 9-volt battery, and the sensor is designed to use as little battery power as possible
cons: May not detect small leaks in time
Would be nice if alarm's volume could be adjusted

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent
customer_reviews.text: This little gadget saved me from incurring major property damage. I came home to a shrieking alarm only to find a pool of water under my hot water tank. I can't recommend it enough. It is most certainly money well spent many times over!
customer_reviews.author: D. Klein

customer_reviews.title: had a new battery in it and it worked fine when i tested it
customer_reviews.text: piece of junk, had flood and it didnt work, had a new battery in it and it worked fine when i tested it, two months later had a flood in basement and it never worked
customer_reviews.author: paul

customer_reviews.title: Small price for a little peace of mind!
customer_reviews.text: Installed two today, one near my hot water heater and one near my sump pump. I ran 18 gauge wire from both to extend them and ran them to the top of my basement stairs so can hear them in the event they go off. (Knock on wood) For the price they are a solid 5 star product. Simple concept with water completing the circuit for the alarm. I am slightly concerned based off of some of the other reviews and them not working but all of my testing using my finger to complete the circuit was successful. These are a nice little addition for a little peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: —

customer_reviews.title: Great device, just needed a few modifications.
customer_reviews.text: Added a on/off switch, a test button, and extended the sensor leads. Works greats. And with the help of a Leeo smart alarm detector, I get alerts straight to my phone for water alarms, smoke alarms, carbon and gas alarms.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Made in China
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item over less expensive alternatives in part because it claimed to be "Mfd. by Glentronics, Inc., lincolnshire, Il 60069". Imagine my surprise when the item's packaging reported that it was "Made in China". I'm pretty sure Illinois hasn't moved to China even though its manufacturing jobs have.
customer_reviews.author: Noirist

customer_reviews.title: Did not work!
customer_reviews.text: Had it less than a year and didn’t even work when we needed it. Didn’t make one peep! I’d even been keeping battery fresh!
customer_reviews.author: Bryce Wilks

customer_reviews.title: I'm fortunate that this was the backup
customer_reviews.text: Fail. The water came the alarm didn't go off. I'm fortunate that this was the backup . I also have the Zircon Leak alert. It functioned perfectly and I was able to avert a flood. Spend the money on the quality item
customer_reviews.author: Cookie Baker

customer_reviews.title: Pass on this, very weak sound.
customer_reviews.text: Having any water issues is no fun. I have periodic sewer backups and am always scared to go down to the basement in fear of what awaits. I was so happy to learn they have water detectors. I wanted one with the loudest sound so I could hear it upstairs. I bought three to try. This one, La Homeita and Shackcom. Sorry, but the Shackcom wins hands down for having the LOUDEST piercing sound:)!! In second place was La Homeita and third place was Glentronics (FYI).
customer_reviews.author: Party Rocker

customer_reviews.title: These work! We have four now, no more worrying.
customer_reviews.text: I just added another one to the house, this time to the drip can for my portable air conditioner. This air conditioner is not designed to be draining all the time so there is no built in alarm or mechanism to turn it off when the water collection is full. I have the air conditioner raised off the floor with a drain into a plastic bin. I added this alarm to the bin so I know when the bin is full. So great and easy to install. I used velcro to the back to hold it to the front of the AC unit. So glad for these alarms, no more worry.
customer_reviews.author: Richie Madden

customer_reviews.title: Is It Working?
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived (very quick delivery, Kudos!) and I have safely installed the 9 Volt battery without alarm going off...However, there is no ON, OFF, Testing button. So I hope it works for our next crawl space old home Leak!! Also great having an extension for the sensor, BUT if extended, the alarm box bottom left fully exposed. Hopefully, several recent costly leaks are indeed fixed. If not, hope alarm goes off.
customer_reviews.author: capnchaos

customer_reviews.title: Long battery life, but lacks low-battery warning, does have decent quality
customer_reviews.text: The claimed battery life is 5 years, which is consistent with my experience. The circuit lacks a low-battery warning, which the competing Flotec water alarm does feature. Flag the alarm in your calendar for periodic testing with a wet finger. Quality of materials and construction are excellent. The audible alarm is quite LOUD, when triggered. The water sensor is on an extensible lead, so that the alarm circuitry can be position well above any accumulation. The lead is long enough that the alarm can be placed at a conveient height on a wall, while the sensor is on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: reify

customer_reviews.title: an inexpensive option to detect water leaks
customer_reviews.text: This product was recommend by a plumber as an inexpensive way to detect water leaks before extensive damage may occur. It is easy to install (it is free standing) and looks like it will do everything I need. I bought this one for my laundry room (specifically the washing machine). Ideally I would have like one that works with my smart home devices but I price point on those devices seems a bridge too far. I will prob buy another one for my water heater in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money. Price to good to be true
customer_reviews.text: I usually do not like to give bad reviews .especially since Amazon os a grest place to shop. I however feel this is not Amazons fault. It is the device manufacturer. And i waited to long before using it. To return It simply is a frustration mu basement is wet so there for the alarm stsys on. Np way to adjust. Sensitivity. Although it state s you can. What can you expect for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Lea

customer_reviews.title: It works as designed, but also when you not at home and then your neighbours....
customer_reviews.text: It works as designed, but keep in mind, when you leave e.g. for a weekend and you have water intrusion it will beep until the batteries are empty and your neighbours, will wonder what is going on in your house, will call you and you will come back for a little puddle (like in my case). It is better to have something that notifies you on your smartphone in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Critical Customer

customer_reviews.title: Saved me Thousands of dollars.
customer_reviews.text: Since I've been in my current home. 1- The sump pump broke 2- The sewer line got clogged 3- The water softener line cracked 4- The shower on the second floor developed a leak that pooled into the basement Each time the alarm went off and I was able to fix the issue quickly. I highly recommend this device or something similar. We don't go to the basement often so if a leak did develop it could be days before we noticed. Buy this or something similar. I'm giving it 5 stars for how well it worked for us. However, I do wish it had an alarm when the battery was low.
customer_reviews.author: T. Whittaker

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great gift for relatives who are clueless
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my grandma, god love her. If her water heater started dripping it would go unnoticed for months due to the location. I bought this as a gift for her and put it in. 6 months later, somehow my stars aligned, and the siren went off. The water heater developed a drip and the thing sounded. This device demands respect and can’t be ignored! Definitely $$$ we’ll spent. Pick up one for your friends and family today.
customer_reviews.author: Eric S

customer_reviews.title: Saved Me from Disaster
customer_reviews.text: Came home from a one night trip to the most horrific alarm sound. Took some hunting but discovered it was one of my water alarms stuffed behind my fridge. My water line to my fridge had sprung a teeny slow leak hole. Last time this happened I had to replace the wood flooring and drywall. This time only a small bit had leaked before the alarm sounded. Note: when I installed the alarm I taped a bunch of paper towels to the floor under the fridge to help guide any leaking water to the alarm. That helped a bunch. Good product. I have one under my dishwasher and another under my sink.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie King

customer_reviews.title: Works so far and is loud.
customer_reviews.text: The unit has two contacts that set off the alarm when water or anything conductive closes the circuit. The contacts are on a plastic plate that slides onto the bottom of the box so you can use it as a self contained unit with the plastic plate attached to the alarm, or there is a 4-6' jumper cable so you can mount the alarm above the water line and have the contacts mounted lower nearer the water. Very simple unit. Audible alarm when the contacts are closed. Putting your fingers on the contacts will close the circuit and set off the alarm.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Works and delivered on time...
customer_reviews.text: Installed in seconds, right where I wanted it behind an ice making machine. I used velcro two piece to stick to the back above the ground, and the sensor laying near the outlet of the drain/pump line. Tested it in the sink many times prior, worked great. Once installed, tested it with water dropped on the floor near it, and presto worked as well. Noisy as hell when triggered! Can hear it throughout the house, will awaken you for sure. Buy with confidence, works with battery so it is going to work when juice to the house is out. In summary, can't see it, can hear it clearly, and it was 'cheap.' Me likes.
customer_reviews.author: Super Dave Osbourne

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up so that I'd know when my heating/AC unit drain got plugged and would require clearing. Sure enough, one night as I was getting ready to go to bed, I heard a continuous, high pitched tone. So I got up and started to investigate, and eventually followed the tone down into my basement, where I finally realized it was coming from the little alarm. And sure enough, there was a small, wet patch next to the heating/AC unit. So I dried the unit off, and cleared the drain, and all was well. Recommend you try it first on a wet paper towel so you know what it sounds like.
customer_reviews.author: Hondo

customer_reviews.title: Life saving
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product that saved my “ass”/ my apartment, hallway and neighbors from flooding and possible other damages caused by slow leaking water heater within one hour after installation. I ordered two and placed one under AC unit and 2nd near water heater. Within one hour my neighbor and security alert me by hearing alarm. Next day when Pride plumber came and check it out, new water heater was ordered. My possible problem was saved by $12.00 water leak detector. I even ordered 2 more for other apartments of mine so tenants will sleep “peacefully “, knowing this detector is “watching for them”😊
customer_reviews.author: Yekaterina Bezpalaya

customer_reviews.title: Great water alarm
customer_reviews.text: This is a great water alarm system. Simple to install and does its job. I tried it out before I placed it in the water heater closet. Our plumber had installed one for the water heater years ago and it had proven to be so valuable. Now we had a leak in a pipe in same closet where of course the water was on the ground, not in the water heater pan. Now the floor is covered, too. Nice loud alarm. Will safe you so much trouble if you ever have a leak! A good idea to put them at toilets, fridges and washers, too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to do and is a good value
customer_reviews.text: I have four of these at various locations in my home, under sinks, near water heaters, near AC systems, etc. Two of them have gone off so far and save me a lot of time and money by catching leaks early. The key is to put a folded up paper towel under the two sensors... That way water will quickly soak into the paper towel and give you a much earlier warning of moisture. to test them simply hold your finger across both sensors and the alarm should go off. Simple device that does what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Pragmatist

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: These are nice, kind of like insurance. I have one of these at base of water heater and it alerted me when a leak occurred. Had it sitting there for years, don’t remember if I ever changed battery, maybe once. Wife asks me one morning what that noise in the laundry room was. Was half asleep but knew immediately. Fortunately I had an aluminum pan placed under water heater and Water didn’t damage my floors. I bought another one of these just in case the previous one got damaged being under water. A must have.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Already came in handy!
customer_reviews.text: While waiting for a busted underground drain pipe to be fixed, all rainwater is currently being sent straight underneath our foundation and out through the sump pump. It hasn't been a problem until this week, when a very heavy rainstorm hit and this little alarm started screaming because our pump wasn't keeping up. It was plainly audible from our first floor living room while watching a movie. I was able run to the basement and toss in my portable pump just in time. I was probably one minute away from having water everywhere. This alarm is already worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Btak

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind on 2nd floor condo with neurotic neighbor
customer_reviews.text: I have these devices scattered in the condo, under the sink, in back of frig (icemaker), under the dishwasher, under HVAC condensate lines, next to the washer and hot water heater, near the guest bath toilet. They work well. Last year one small drip overnight cost $950 and my neighbor to go absolutely crazy so sure there was black mold growing after a quick leak was found and repaired. I'd rather hear these loud alarms first if there is the smallest leak than answer the front door with a visit from her. BTW no black mold was found with the quick response. Hoping to see blue tooth and wi fi added soon.
customer_reviews.author: jrmi

customer_reviews.title: Hard to tell if it's installed correctly
customer_reviews.text: The sensor pad is basically the bottom plastic piece of the device with two wires attached to metallic pads. It works by water completing the connection between these two pads. Unfortunately, the plastic 'pad' is very light and is easily lifted off the surface to be monitored (i.e. the floor) by the attached wires. So if it's installed behind something that you can't see, such as behind a dish washer, there's no way to be certain the plastic pad is sitting flat on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: J. Olivo

customer_reviews.title: These gadgets are worth every cent. A life saver!!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this product 10 stars I would. Saved us from water damage today. The drain hose on my Lennox Mini Split heat pump backed up into my house dripping water for the second time in a little over a year. I bought this little gadget after the first incident and it started screaming at us letting us know the unit was dripping again! I have these units on my 2 hot water heaters, washing machine hoses, sinks, my A/C units. If you have ever had a water leak they suck. PS: DO NOT BUY A LENNOX MINI SPLIT HEAT PUMP. THEY ARE NOT WORTH A CRAP. IF I COULD SUE THEM I WOULD.
customer_reviews.author: avs49

customer_reviews.title: Save the day
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought and install this for my basement following a flood from a leaking hot water heater (we did not have any alarm at that time). On a recent Monday when we had an unusually heavy morning of torrential rain fall (reported to be up to 5 inch within a 2 hour period), muddy water came into the basement via the crawl space. Fortunately my wife heard this device's loud alarm and went to investigate. To make a long story short, we were able to limit the damage from another flood because of this alarm. For the price of this alarm, we were saved from another disastrous flood in the basement.
customer_reviews.author: Hotl4yen

customer_reviews.title: HAD WATER LEAK, DIDN'T DETECT IT - NUFF SAID
customer_reviews.text: I put this in an AC closet upstairs to detect water before it drained through the floor and onto the first floor ceiling. We just got power after Hurricane Irma and the AC has been running 24/7 to stabilize the temps. And this morning, there is a bright brown spot on my first floor ceiling. The AC leaked. There sat the Watchdog, quite as a mouse. I removed the unit and tested the battery - it was ok. I replaced the battery anyway and dunked the unit in water to test it. It sat there, placidly. I bought this to detect a water leak and it did not. I have never been more angry at a product in my life.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Castaneda

customer_reviews.title: Smart choice for early warning
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these and like the design and simplicity so much that I purchased TWO more! I put one under the kitchen sink in case the dishwasher, garbage disposal, or sink drain leaks for any reason. I put another one behind the water heater (between the water heater and the drain) to alarm if it ever detects a leaking water heater. For the third one I dangled the detachable (but wired) sensor into the sump pump drain to alarm if the sump pump ever fails. Flooded basement = $THOUSANDS$, ... but this little watch dog is only a few bucks. I would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: N. Dured

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect and at an amazing price
customer_reviews.text: Looked at a bunch of options and decided to go with this model for our sump pump, the same plugin that the sump is connected to I put a green night light plug in so that when we walk into the storage room I can see the the sump pump has power instantly. Tested it and it worked immediately under water and was loud enough to hear upstairs. This really is a bare bones sensor but does exactly what I needed it to do at a very low cost. Very happy with my order and definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Just trying to help =)

customer_reviews.title: Saved me twice now!!
customer_reviews.text: My drain system runs through my pantry which is the lowest point for water to back up. Twice this thing has alerted me and saved my bacon. I don't go into the pantry very often and it is built with brick from floor to ceiling. The alarm is loud enough to get through that brick wall, and alert me in my kitchen when something goes wrong. Today it did again. Family was over putting food down the drain, I have a 90 degree turn in my drain pipe that I can't reach, so it backed up immediately. The alarm went off and I was able to stop the flood before it got worse. Great device.
customer_reviews.author: E. Pickron

customer_reviews.title: Great item to have to warn of water issues
customer_reviews.text: Like many others, I picked up this product to put next to the hot water heater and near a sump pump. I likely will pick up a few more for under the sinks as of course water damage is a real pain to deal with and potentially very expensive. The only reason for 4 instead of 5 stars is the sensor is not heavy enough to stay on the ground so I had to use some duct tape to keep it where the water will be if a leak should occur. I tested the unit with a small amount of water and it worked as expected and the alarm was certainly loud enough.
customer_reviews.author: Minnesota Customer

customer_reviews.title: Every home should have one You do not need a Wi-Fi
customer_reviews.text: The cheap one is better than the Wi-Fi 1 ... I got one from my mother in law and I bought a kitchen faucet from Amazon was watching TVI heard my alarm went off yes as I said my water alarm my kitchen faucet fell apart underneath kicthen sink,,well it did not cause a lot of damage because I have my water alarm... Just in time so I think every home should have one in their bathroom kitchen laundry Room anywhere you have water tank you name it you should always have one,,,,, so I Got another 1 from Amazon ,,, I got it today ..... thank you Amazon I love it.
customer_reviews.author: No

customer_reviews.title: Just awesome - simple and functional
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the simplicity of this sensor, the alarm is strong enough that I can hear it on second floor when it goes off inside my HVAC closet in my basement. Extremely effective and has saved me a big time with a leak... To make it more effective place it on a folded paper towel which increases the surface area and as the water gets absorbed the alarm would go off. I am buying more now :)
customer_reviews.author: Anand

customer_reviews.title: Saves $$$$ and heartache
customer_reviews.text: We have used these for years - just had a friend have to replace their entire kitchen subfloor from a leaky dishwasher! So while we have used these for water heaters and washing machines....I bought another one for my dishwasher. Water can be so damaging....this sounds like a fire alarm and can be heard from another level in the house. We caught an early leak in our water heater and avoided a mess when the basement laundry had issues....neither would have been caught this early without this alarm. We also put these in our rental units!
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Good item
customer_reviews.text: We installed a new sump pump(Wayne submersible) and set this up in case it ever fails. Since sump is in unfinished area in back of the house and we would not hear it while sleeping we spiced in wire and ran up through out floor and mounted in our bedroom closet. Works perfectly. Sump is one room over from a recent 30K kitchen remodel we want to protect from basement flooding. Next we plan to install battery backup on sump in case power goes out during heavy rain.
customer_reviews.author: Buysalotofwatches

customer_reviews.title: Cheap insurance
customer_reviews.text: If you have a dishwasher, ice maker or worried about under the sink leaks then this works great. The only issue is that if you detach and extend the sensor to put under a dishwasher there isn't any way to test the battery without pulling out the sensor and crossing the two probes. What I did was install a momentary, push button switch to be able to test the battery, item #:B01E6SBB5E. If you have it standing as a single unit then you can just test the battery by putting you finger over the two probes.

customer_reviews.title: cheap insurance / Takes a little of the worry out of home-ownership
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 4 of these flood detectors. When the copper pipes start getting old, you need to watch them closely.. Until you can install PEX.. These work per spec. I've had a similar unit (w/ remote sensor) on my main sump-pump rig for decades. So it seems like a good time to replace it. I sat one in the catch tub under the new hotwater heater. Just in case. Left one in the flood prone west side of the basement (where woodchucks tunneled under the slab).. These flood detectors are cheap insurance. Takes a little of the worry out of home-ownership. Since 1973, I've found a lot of H2O surprises in the basement.. Those days are over!
customer_reviews.author: Old Retired Man

customer_reviews.title: Best investment you can make next to smoke detectors
customer_reviews.text: These devices have saved me money on multiple occasions. Put one under every sink, by the washer, dishwasher, water heater, and anywhere else you might have a small leak down the road. Even in my *new* house, it alerted me to a small leak under the bathroom sink that I would have never noticed until damage was done. In my old house it alerted my daily house checker to a leak and the water was turned off accordingly. These are so good that home insurance companies should hand them out for free or give a discount for using them.
customer_reviews.author: AmznCust

customer_reviews.title: Installed in 2016 and paid for itself tonight!!! A Must Have!
customer_reviews.text: Ok this just NOW paid for itself tonight. Turned on dishwasher and went to bed. Within minutes heard the alarm from 3 rooms over and ran to find a small amount of water under the sink. Without this alarm we would have had a huge mess in the morning. After a Kitchen remodel in 2016 due to a water leak we have (3) alarms. One behind fridge, one under the sink and another under the sink with the sensor under the dishwasher. Life saver ...highly recommend. Water damage is no joke.
customer_reviews.author: sam montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Very sensitive
customer_reviews.text: The first one of these which I bought years ago worked so well, I've bought more over the years and they always work very well. I have one under my kitchen sink, behind the clothes washer, at the base of my water heater, at the corner of my freezer (door left open results in defrost and water leaking out - good to know that door is not fully closed), and I've even put one in the drain pan under my inside AC unit.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Super pleased----it alerted us today !
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this March 2018 and placed it under our kitchen sinks. Totally forgot about it. Today we were startled with a blaring alarm. We thought it was a false smoke/fire alarm--nope. Then we thought it was the house security alarm---nope. We started opening doors and drawers looking for whatever was making the blasting noise. Upon opening the kitchen sink cabinet---we found it. THANK GOODNESS. Our garbage disposal was leaking. We really can give this alarm our full recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Jane in Atlanta

customer_reviews.title: It works!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 mobile air conditioners and I always worry that they will start leaking and ruin my new hardwood floors. These water sensors work great and are priced right. They work on a very simple principle and seem to be very reliable. I plan to order more - one for my water heater and for under my kitchen sink. I highly recommend and am very pleased that I chose this model over the more"sophisticated" models now available.
customer_reviews.author: SBA

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but doesn’t work for us
customer_reviews.text: We installed this in our basement for our sump pump and in the month and a half we have had it, it has given us 2 “false alarms”. Condensation builds up and makes the alarm go off but unfortunately the alarm isn’t loud enough to be hear from up stairs. We will be looking for a new alarm.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Keller

customer_reviews.title: Soooo good. Love this company for making it!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve now had this for about three years. We got it after our basement flooded twice and left us to replace our drywall and carpet both times. So, I bought this cheap little alarm with my fingers crossed that you could get much from a $15 device. This thing has now saved us at least 6 times from where our sump pump (which was installed after the basements floods) needs reset and in the mean time, the water has started to creep into our basement in the utility closet. This thing is great! $15 once is better than $1000 for our deductible 7 times.
customer_reviews.author: Codisfish

customer_reviews.title: Seems like it would be a very helpful product for peace of mind and catching a leak quickly.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a total of four of these. Three of them performed excellently when I tested them and the fourth was a little less so. I like the fact that you can hang the main body with the batteries on a stud or wall while the sensor remains on the floor. I would have preferred these to be even louder since I put two of these in my crawl space. I believe their rated dB output is in line with similar products. Louder would just be fine with me. I probably will buy some more of this product.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: ZZZZZZZZ... Huh? What's that noise????
customer_reviews.text: Got to put this thing to the test the first night I used it. My water heater has developed a nasty habit of lifting the safety valve. First time it happened 3 weeks ago , what a mess! Lost a day of work mopping up and dealing with kitty litter mud on the floor (thanks, guys). Put this gizmo in a gallon jug and put that on the end of the drain pipe on the safety. It woke me up at 5AM and I got into the bathroom in time to turn on the sink and allow the valve to close. Not as huge a mess as the first time. Money well spent! Now to figure out the safety valve...
customer_reviews.author: Mindless Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Saved my basement three times already
customer_reviews.text: I have several Watchdog alarms in my basement. A few years ago, one of them alerted me to a broken pipe at the washing machine. Last year, I got the alert that my HVAC condensate pump had overflowed. And just a few days ago in the flooding rains in the DC area, it alerted me right away to water pouring into my basement from a blocked drain at the side entrance. This alarm has saved me lots of money because in all cases I was able to mop and sop up water with towels before too large a spread of water.
customer_reviews.author: June Rose

customer_reviews.title: Cheap insurance!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. (If I can do it, anyone can.) Why everyone in the world wouldn't buy this, I don't know. The lowest-priced insurance you can buy. I live in a one-bedroom apartment and bought four of 'em: kitchen sink, toilet, bathroom sink, and water heater. Battery-operated (which is great, for convenience) so I put a note in my calendar to change the batteries every six months. I think I'll buy 10 more and give 'em away as holiday gifts.
customer_reviews.author: crimsonkng

customer_reviews.title: Simple, works, inexpensive, and easily modified.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very simple and inexpensive device and a great starting place for a DIY. I spliced in a 75 foot run of 22 g bell wire so that the sensor could be in the low spot of a basement while the alarm box is in the first floor laundry, where it can be heard. I also mounted an on-off switch and a push-to-test button in the top of the box (plenty of room). That way the 9v battery can be tested any time and it can be turned off (no need to remove battery) while cleaning up any flood.
customer_reviews.author: Alan D

customer_reviews.title: Paid for itself in less than a month
customer_reviews.text: I installed a new sump pump, and being a belt and suspenders guy, I put one of these in also. The alarm alerted us to the fact that the sump pump had failed and the water level, while still in the sump, was rising. I quickly reinstalled the old pump and got the water out. This alarm was easy to install. I will move it so that it is just below the floor and above the floor insulation to make it easier to hear. This item has great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Coorpender

customer_reviews.title: Why not own several
customer_reviews.text: I have had a problem with line and valve failures behind toilets and occasional instances of multitasking while overfilling the sink. This item saved the day. But here is a tip, if the surface is slightly uneven it may not alert if water does not accumulate around the bottom of the device. set the device on a piece of paper towel as soon as the paper absorbs some water the contacts are immediately in contact with the towel and the alrm sounds off as loud as a smoke detector!
customer_reviews.author: David J.

customer_reviews.title: I own 3 they work great!
customer_reviews.text: I kept ordering these for different parts of the house because I have a one hundred year old house and I am worried about leaks when I'm not around. I have one by the toilet, by my washing machine, and under the kitchen sink. The one by the washing machine has gone off before. It is loud enough to hear up two floors and doesn't need much water to go off. They are terrific.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca C.

customer_reviews.title: SUPER LOUD
customer_reviews.text: I seen reviews before purchasing that said it wasn't that loud, and they had trouble hearing it upstairs. That was not the case for me, i guess it depends how and where you mount it. I have the sensor in the sump crock, with a plastic cover so splashing water cant hit it. The actual box with the speaker that makes all the racket is pointed up. When this thing goes off you can hear it upstairs.
customer_reviews.author: tim cowell

customer_reviews.title: These are great. They are inexpensive and the batteries last a ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great. They are inexpensive and the batteries last a long time in them. These have saved us serious water damage on several occasions. You can't have too many. We have these next to all of our floor drains in our basement. When water backed up, we caught it before it flooded the basement. We have one under the kitchen sink. Once our dishwasher drain hose popped out of the drain pipe and this alerted us to it within seconds. We recently had valve under our dishwasher start leaking, but we didn't have an alarm there. We may have to replace some hardwood. Now we have a plastic pan for dishwashers and one of these alarms underneath.
customer_reviews.author: Travis R

customer_reviews.title: A Great Leak Detector
customer_reviews.text: Use two of these, one under the kitchen sink and the othese only issue is minor, need to weight the sensor to keep it in contact with the monitored surface or the sensor wiring tends to lift it. A paper towel placed on the detection area with the sensor weighted on top works well.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: I could easily have had several feet of water in the basement ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this alarm 6/16, put a battery in it, placed it on the floor in front of the hot water heater and forgot about it until late last night, 12/17. My heater burst and the alarm went off letting me know water was on the floor. Without it, I would have had a major catastrophe. I shut down the well pump preventing a continuous flow of water and "only" had to deal with the 50 gallons leaking from the tank. I could easily have had several feet of water in the basement had I not used this water alarm. It was so inexpensive I wonder if it would work and now I know it works GREAT.
customer_reviews.author: Barb S.

customer_reviews.title: Small investment, big potential benefit
customer_reviews.text: We've had water damage in three homes. It is very costly recovering from even a small leak. The most recent one is pushing $20K for a small reverse osmosis leak. I wish I had one of these by the R.O. system. It would have save us with a 60-day recovery effort and a sizable deductible. My recommendation: One under each sink, one by the washing machine, one by the water heater and one by a reverse osmosis, if you have one.' [I had one by the water heater. We now have more of 'em.]
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for around Water Heater or Aquarium
customer_reviews.text: I have salt water aquariums and this is perfect for a number of places in my home where water could cause damage. It has saved me from catastrophic damage. I now use these on the lower level of my house around my water heater and areas of water I contain for water changes in my aquarium. Highly recommend. As these are in the basement and I do not go down there very often It would help if they were a little louder.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy B McKinley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value if your home often.
customer_reviews.text: The only improvement I can think of is adding a second blank cover for the bottom to help keep any extra wire slack cleaner. I'd buy this again. I have one on the floor by our basement windows were I had water come in before (our basement is finished). Another one is below the water filter. I mounted both alarms off the ground and ran the electrodes to the floor. I made a reminder to replace the batteries when they expire (unless the alarm goes off before). If your not home often, I seen wifi alarms for about $80/each that'll send you an email or notification if water is detected.
customer_reviews.author: odoylerules

customer_reviews.title: Added these to my aquarium setup because of Alexa Guard
customer_reviews.text: I've used these for years for my water heater and in my crawl space but when I found out that Alexa Guard would notify me of alarms, decided to pick up one for each of my aquariums. Now, if one starts to leak while I'm away, I *SHOULD* get a notification from Alexa. Hopefully I'll never have to actually hear one of these but I have tested them all and they work really well. The added bonus of Alexa Guard alerting me to when they go off is a nice bonus.
customer_reviews.author: M. Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Nice alarm / water sensor
customer_reviews.text: I spend alot of time in my garage, and the last thing I want to have happen in there is a water leak, especially when we are gone and on vacation. Our water heater is built into an enclosure and this sensor gives me piece of mind, in case water should ever build up at the base of the tank, for any reason. I've attached a pic of the garage (water heater is behind the dart board). Feature wise, I really thought it was smart how the manufacturer provided plenty of extra cable in case a person wants to mount the alarm, away from the sensor (like I needed to).
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: STOP READING REVIEWS AND BUY THIS NOW
customer_reviews.text: I'm cruising the internet one night in my second floor bedroom when I hear this faint screeching sound. After ruling out the computer, it dawned on me- THE WATER ALARM. I went down two flights of stairs to the basement and discovered the drain backing up. Called a plumber, saved the newly-renovated basement, and the rest is history.
customer_reviews.author: Amy L

customer_reviews.title: A good warning alarm
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to provide an alert if my sump pump fails and the pit overflows. The alarm could be louder and the sump pump pit is in the basement. The alarm is very sensitive to moisture which I like. It was just installed three weeks ago so I do not know how long the batteries will last. Good alarm for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Lennie J

customer_reviews.title: Just good piece of mind knowing that they sense any small ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for our studio apartment downstairs to monitor any potential water leaks in the kitchen sink cabinet & the bathroom vanity cabinet where any water leaks aren't noticed until it's too late & caused water damage. Just good piece of mind knowing that they sense any small traces of moisture. After purchasing them, I installed the 9 volt batteries (purchased separately) & tested them with just my two finger tips & the alarm is very loud & high pitched to give you notice. These can also be used at the base of your water heater to let you know when you have a leaking tank.
customer_reviews.author: John Plato

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be easier! Put a battery in it and set it on the floor. A+
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be easier. The sensor part can be detached as shown in the picture, but doesn't need to be. Personally, I left it as is. I just put a 9-volt battery in it and set it on the floor. That's it! I live in a basement apartment, and there's a corner in one closet where leaks start maybe twice per year. If I'm sleeping, it can spread 1/2 inch of water across half my place, damaging anything on the floor and generally being a pain. Thanks to this alarm, I wake up the second the leak starts and can use towels and a shop wet-vac to keep it from spreading. Sooo easy, Sooo worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Mcgraw

customer_reviews.title: I fixed the clog properly this time and Its standingwatch still just in case
customer_reviews.text: Worked just as advertised. Had an HVAC that was backing up into the house due to a clog I thought I cleared twice! This little guy stared screaming about 11:30 at night the day after I put it next to the area where the back up was happening. Rather then wake up to a soaked floor and carpet and water damage I was immediately able to prevent any damage to the house. Worth the money I spent on it. I fixed the clog properly this time and Its standing watch still just in case. so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Josh L.

customer_reviews.title: How could this possible be of any value
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this alarm as we recently wen through a flooding in our laundry room and did not ever want this to happen again. When I received the unit, I put a battery in it and connected the leads with a jump wire to see what would happen. It does emit a sound but the sound is not loud enough to carry more then about 15 feet away from the source!!!. What the heck! It is nothing like testing your fire alarm and having to cover your ear to avoid the pain. If you have to be in practically right next to it to hear it, what good is it? I'm sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Raquel Danielle

customer_reviews.title: a quality item
customer_reviews.text: This device is US made and it shows: It is much better quality than the el cheapo ones. The battery is easy to replace, and the external sensor comes with a solid cable and both can be stowed inside the device. it is also possible to use the device without the external sensor. I use is as an alarm for my sump pump system.
customer_reviews.author: dswiss

customer_reviews.title: NOT LOUD IN COMPARISON...nothing more important than that
customer_reviews.text: NOT LOUD IN COMPARISON...nothing more important than that. The WIRED SENSOR WAS SHORT IN LENGTH, putting the alarm on the other side of my 5' pool equipment wall was limited to a small area. So the instructions say I could lengthen the wire myself. How about giving me 3' more wire instead! This is a DON'T BUY ITEM.
customer_reviews.author: Bob C.

customer_reviews.title: They work well
customer_reviews.text: Ok these may not be the coolest looking latest technology items, but let me say this THEY WORK! Installed them around our house as this builders homes are known to have a leak from time to time. I had long since forgot about them and then one night we heard beeping took awhile but we discovered it was one of. These behind the fridge that had developed a small leak from the ice maker line. Saved out bacon.
customer_reviews.author: s33flyer

customer_reviews.title: Sounded off when a very minor kitchen sink leak occurred, thus avoiding something more costly. , This is a great product!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, cheap protection from water leaks. I have one of these in my drain pan that is around my water heater and it has sat silently working for several years. The battery has lasted years and I test it often. I had another under my kitchen sink, below the cut off valves and it sounded off when there was very, very little moisture present, preventing a major problem and fixing a very minor one. This made me a believer in these units. Since I have ordered more and have them stationed where water flows. I think these are an excellent item and highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Wohali

customer_reviews.title: THIS SAVED OUR APARTMENT
customer_reviews.text: This saved our apartment. We had the extender wire connected to the drip pan of our washer and It worked when needed. The washer overflowed and this little device sounded like the ear piercing cell-phone state of emergency warning. I jumped to the washer, shut off the water feed, and the apartment saved from potential disaster. Buy one. It is a small insurance policy worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Bought two, 108 dB, easy setup. Sensing plate can be face down on metal.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two of these for hot water heaters. Installed batteries, put sensing plate into very shallow (1/16”) of plain city tap water on a plastic plate and both responded immediately. Decibel meter reading for both - 108 dB each. Sensing plate has plastic tabs around electrodes that raise the electrodes about 1/32” so you can put sensing plate face down on metal (drip pan) and the electrodes won’t contact the metal. Only drawback is no “low battery” warning.
customer_reviews.author: Janet M

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use water leak alarm
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up ..just put inAAA batteries and place it on ground near water heater or sump pump or any area you want to monitor water leaks or water overflow. It went off when I had a small leak of water from air conditioner in basement. The alarm was loud enough that I heard it on the second floor of my home. Not sure how long battery will last as I have only had the unit for a few months.
customer_reviews.author: S.T.

customer_reviews.title: saved me from a major headache
customer_reviews.text: When a pipe broke and water formed in my basement (that I rarely go to), the alarm alerted me to the problem. Saved me from a much worse problem.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: High water alarm.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to alert me if my sump in my crawl space stops working. The first one I got I put the battery in it and laid it on my bench in my garage. Next morning it was making a low squealing sound. I took out the battery and wiped the contacts and put battery in. Next morning same thing. Returned it to Amazon for replacement, fast replacement and no charge return shipment. So far this one is working as it should.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest W. Johnston

customer_reviews.title: No home should be without several of these
customer_reviews.text: We have one under every sink, next to each toilet, one next to the washing machine, and where ever water might leak. The slightest moister sets it off with a loud squeal (the dogs hate it) but it alerts you to a problem before it becomes a costly problem. The batteries do last 5 years by my experience.
customer_reviews.author: marvin

customer_reviews.title: Saved our wood floor
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product to place under our central ac unit as the drain for it had stopped up in the past and caused over $5000 in damage to our wood floors before we realized there was even a problem. The alarm went off notifying of another stopped up drain before any damage had occurred. Absolutely great product and worth its wait in gold!
customer_reviews.author: Tim Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Invaluable tool for aquarium maintenence.
customer_reviews.text: I use this when I'm cleaning and doing water changes in my aquariums. I fill my 64 gallon garbage can with water for the change and I always get sidetracked. This has prevented overflow disasters too numerous to count. I also transfer it to the tank when I' refilling it. It makes quite a racket and turns off immediately when removed from the water. The cord is nice and long so I can set it on the chair next to the aquarium. I plan on getting a couple more. I have 6 aquariums and it makes water changes almost enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: DStubitsch

customer_reviews.title: It worked!
customer_reviews.text: 6 months after renovating the kitchen a compression fitting under the sink failed. I was at work, but my wife was still home getting ready for work and heard the alarm. She went downstairs and saw the water and immediately shut off the water valve at the meter. There was quite a mess and the white oak floor does appear to have some minor warping, but it would have been much worse if not for the alarm. I will buy a couple for the bathroom and laundry room.
customer_reviews.author: ultru63

customer_reviews.title: It saved me from serious water damage.
customer_reviews.text: This product has saved me from serious water damage. I had this water sensor installed under my kitchen sink. One day, I was washing dishes and heard a loud alarm from under the sink. To my astonishment, the garage disposal rusted out from the bottom and water leaked out. Imagine the damage if I didnt have this sensor?!
customer_reviews.author: Lani37

customer_reviews.title: Worthwhile Investment
customer_reviews.text: Our ac drain got clogged and slow leaked behind the wall for I don't even know how long! By the time we noticed, most of the subfloor was destroyed. I have bought one of these to place next to the unit and water heater. We tested and it doesn't take much to set it off, so this won't happen again! I will replace the batteries along with changing the smoke detectors yearly.
customer_reviews.author: robnic0207

customer_reviews.title: Decent economical safety alarm to minimize unexpected water accumulation in basement/under sinks!
customer_reviews.text: I get water in basement. These are available at the bigger box stores for about the same price. Yet I needed more than 1. Item does work, yet I don't think the 1/8" of water setting off alarm claim is correct. Water heater developed leak (happens), and while a water absorbing "dam" was around the resulting water, it's didn't hold all back. This item didn't respond to what was likely 1/8" of standing water. In dish it did react at a bit less then 1/4" inch. So, be aware it's not fully fail safe.
customer_reviews.author: Brad K

customer_reviews.title: Installed easily
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit to replace an older similar unit that failed. I made a longer harness wire between the sensor and the alarm body so I could mount the alarm body at the head of the stairway while the water sensor is mounted to the rim of my sump pump well. Doing this gives me the loudest alarm level on the main floor of the house and by putting the alarm body at the head of the stairs I know I have a water problem in the basement.
customer_reviews.author: Able

customer_reviews.title: Happy I have it.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item quite a while ago. It's the kind of thing that sits quietly in my basement and can be easily forgotten. Until yesterday. After several days of zero degree weather, we experienced a lot of heavy rain. Just the kind of conditions that promote water to follow basement walls until an opening is found. The Watchdog's loud alarm got my attention and I was able to control the situation. Happy I have this product.
customer_reviews.author: M. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Work great.  Using a long life lithium battery is best
customer_reviews.text: I really like the remote sensor. I put it in my sump pit above where my main pump lets water up to but in the range where the backup pump kicks in so I know if there has been a primary failure so I can fix it and maintain redundancy. Also great for sinks, behind the fridge and washer.
customer_reviews.author: Phil B

customer_reviews.title: Great water alert!!
customer_reviews.text: Reliable and audible. This is my second Watchdog - the first one gave out after 10 years of solid service. I've found these to be very reliable and I can hear the tone all the way on the 2nd floor, opposite side of the house. This device is set up to be the "first alert" of water in the basement - the 2nd one alerts the alarm company (in case I am not home). Its saved me numerous times from a basement filled with water (where the furnace and hot water heater sit), and I appreciate it tremendously.
customer_reviews.author: CanHope

customer_reviews.title: cannot recommend
customer_reviews.text: worked 1 time when main pump failed...now just screams at you even when completely dry and use brand new battery..bought 2, used one..other still in package in junk box
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Saved me a mess!
customer_reviews.text: This thing saved me lots of headaches! I bought it as an early warning system as our basement rarely gets water, but it was a "just in case" my sump pump failed. Well, I had the float valve set too high and water started creeping up in small pools on the slab. This little guy went off and saved me quite a bit of damage. I've since bought two more and placed them in different places on the basement floor. If my pump screws up, at least I'll have a backup to yell at me that the water is rising. Saved my bacon!
customer_reviews.author: D.S. - Lancaster PA

customer_reviews.title: Got a replacement. First one broke down within just over a year of use
customer_reviews.text: I've contacted Glentronics to ask for a replacement. Will try and update with how long it took to get it. But for now, rating as 1 star since it didn't live up to its promise. Thankfully there was no damage to my house, but I verified the battery was still fine using another device that takes a 9V battery, so it must have been this unit. Update: Glentronics shipped a replacement within days and it was a good, hassle free experience. Updated from 1 to 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: embrangler

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 of these around the house and they work great. I change the batteries every year just to be on the safe side. I like that I have the option of removing the sensor plate from the enclosure and be flexible on my placement. I wish they make one with an AC plug.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: I like the versatility of The Watchdog with the possibility of the six foot extension for the sensor itself. While it did not come with a battery the compartment door slid off with no tool required although it does not appear to be water tight. Also order both a Govee and a Honeywell water detector at the same time. The Honeywell never worked. The Govee, a nice compact unit, worked right out of the box since it came with a battery already installed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Earned it's keep the second day.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these. Put one in the basement and one under the kitchen sink. Next day the one under the kitchen sink started screaming. Startled the heck out of me. Checked and saw that a small amount of water had leaked from the drain pipe. Probably had been doing this for a long time. Never would have known if I had not put this thing under the sink. Bought another couple of these and sent one to a couple of my relatives.
customer_reviews.author: Raven

customer_reviews.title: Definitely works
customer_reviews.text: We have this placed below a Utility Sink in our garage, that also serves as the outlet for our washing machine. I have filters on the outlet washing machine hose, but the sink still gets clogged up and the washing machine pumps it out faster than the sink can empty it and it has overflowed onto the garage floor before. But this time, we heard the alarm and went out and shut down the washing machine, preventing yet another flooded garage floor. So, not intentionally, we tested it and it worked.
customer_reviews.author: js75080

customer_reviews.title: Update - Saved Major Damage to hardwood floors
customer_reviews.text: Our sink is on an island, and all the pipes are completely hidden. We had a leak, with hardwood floor damage before we noticed it. Hope this doesn't sound of indicating another leak, but if we do, this is sure to alert us. Update. BE SURE ALL HOUSEHOLD MEMBERS know what it sounds like and means if unit is hidden. Wife went about nuts when hidden unit under kitchen island alarmed from defective faucet, until I arrived home, and shut it, and water off. 😁
customer_reviews.author: Judge Dean

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap insurance
customer_reviews.text: Very sensitive sensor as the moisture on your fingers is enough to set off the piercing alarm. I like the fact that it takes 9 volt batteries as some units have built in batteries that are a hassle to deal with. The long wire allows me to suspend the electrodes into my sump so I will get a warning if my pump fails to do its job and I can go stop the clothes washer in time. Our washer empties into the sump because the plumbing is uphill. Frequent sump use makes this item a neccesity in my house.
customer_reviews.author: SuperNurse

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: No surprises here. It works as advertised. I can set off the alarm by touching both sensors at the same time with a finger. So it is quite sensitive. I have it sitting on the floor in the basement in case the sump pump fails or the water heater springs a leak or whatever else could cause water on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Drac

product_meta.title: Glentronics, Inc. BWD-HWA 00895001498 Basement Watchdog High Water Alarm, Pack of 1, Multi
product_meta.description:
Size:Pack of 1Water damage is one of the main ways that the value of a home can be diminished. Accidents will happen! Water heaters break down and water pours out, washing machines overflow, pipes wear thin and leak - and when these things happen, water will start to destroy your home. Perhaps the most dangerous aspect of water damage is that it can occur with almost no sound - you may not know you have a leak until your basement is flooded! Now, you can minimize the risk of water damage with this Water Alarm. The Water Alarm requires only a 9-volt battery (battery not included), and when placed on the floor it can detect water that is only 1/32"deep! This is thanks to solid state circuitry which is highly reliable. The Water Alarm also has a 6-foot sensor wire, so that you can extend it into a sump pump, or simply mount it on a wall to stretch it to another location. Plus, up to an additional 200 feet of wire can easily be spliced in to provide extra length. When the Water Alarm detects water it emits a loud 110 decibel alarm (as loud as most car horns)! And don't worry that you will miss this alarm if you are out of the house when water is first detected - the Water Alarm will sound continuously for 2-3 days (depending on existing battery life). Consider one for the basement, one for the kitchen, the bathroom, or anywhere that water may become a hazard. Keep your home safe and secure with the Water Alarm. Assembly level/degree of difficulty: No Assembly Required.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Minimize the risk of water damage with this early warning system For installation in sump pits or near areas requiring water monitoring like hot water heaters, air conditioners, washing machines or under sinks. Requires a 9-volt battery (Sold separately). Solid state circuitry is extremely sensitive and reliable. Detects water only 1/32-Inch deep when the alarm is placed on the floor. The Sensor has a 6-foot wire so it can be extended into a sump pit, or mounted on a wall and stretched to another location. (Accommodates the addition of more than 100 feet of wire, if needed). Loud 110dB alarm can be heard throughout the house. Battery-saver feature keeps batteries fresh longer. for 24 to 48 months
